editor

Class TextAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.AbstractAction
      • ca.queensu.cs.dal.edfmwk.act.DefaultAction
        • editor.TextAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.Action
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CapitalizeAction, DeleteAction, DownCaseAction, UpCaseAction

    public abstract class TextAction
extends ca.queensu.cs.dal.edfmwk.act.DefaultAction
    Parent for Actions for implementing changes to the current text selection. Subclasses need only implement the changeText(editor.TextContents, int, int) method.

    Copyright 2010-2011 David Alex Lamb. See the copyright notice for details.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • changeText

        protected abstract void changeText(TextContents con,
                                   int start,
                                   int end)
        Perform some appropriate change on a selected region of text; subclasses must implement this method. If start and end are equal, the operation might do nothing (as in capitalization) or might affect the character before the start or after the end (as in using a delete or backspace key).
        Parameters:
        con - Text document to change.
        start - Index of the first character to change.
        end - Index one beyond the last character to change.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Perform the appropriate action (defined by changeText(editor.TextContents, int, int)) on the currently-selected region of the document.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Overrides:
        actionPerformed in class ca.queensu.cs.dal.edfmwk.act.DefaultAction
